content:
Hugo is the best choice to build a simple static site, and of course, Hugo is the most popular static site generator, which has a great community that believes in it and supports making it as good as possible. Hugo is also using Markdown, which makes building static sites fast, flexible, and easy to modify. Also, you can use Hugo to make a site at a low cost if you use it with GitHub as a host and connect it with your domain name from a domain name provider such as GoDaddy, with no cost if you use GitHub Pages.

In this post, I will show you how I created this site using Hugo and a theme named Profile.

  1. What are static sites, and how do they work?
  2. static site generator
  3. Site structure in Hugo
  4. Hosting the Hugo site on GitHub

Static sites

Web development begins with the static site; in general, static sites are those that do not use a programming language (link in Wikipedia) or database (the same thing) in the backend.A site that uses a programming language and a database is referred to as “dynamic."(Here is a dynamic vs. static site article that can help you.)

A static site generator is a tool that makes static sites fun and easy to build, as well as flexible to changes that you want to make every time without touching the code.

So, using this tool, you can create a fast site while also making it more dynamic and responsive to changes.
In web development, we have many SSGs like Gasby and Hugo.

How static site generator work ?

A static site generator is a tool that generates a full static HTML website based on raw data and a set of templates. A static site generator, in essence, automates the task of coding individual HTML pages and makes those pages ready to serve to users ahead of time. Because these HTML pages are pre-built, they can load very quickly in users’ browsers. More

Hugo

installing Hugo on your OS and run this command.

hugo version

example@name:~$ hugo version
hugo v0.110.0-e32a493b7826d02763c3b79623952e625402b168+extended linux/amd64 BuildDate=2023-01-17T12:16:09Z VendorInfo=gohugoio

Now we need to create a new project.

hugo new site myFirstPost

.
├── archetypes          |
│   └── default.md      |
├── assets              |
├── config.toml         |
├── content             | 'Your website's content, such as articles'
├── data                | 
├── layouts             |
├── public              |
├── static              | 'All non-HTML files, such as cv.pdf'
└── themes              |

Download Theme Profile NB: Make sure that you have the profile theme in the themes folder so you can use it. Add the following to the config.toml file: NB: You can copy config.yml from /profile/exampleSite/config.yml to your site directory.

theme='profile' # if you have config.yml - theme:'profile'

.
├── archetypes
│   └── default.md
├── assets
├── config.yaml
├── content
│   └── blogs
├── data
├── layouts
├── public
├── resources
│   └── _gen
├── static
│   ├── config.toml
│   ├── fav.png
│   └── images
└── themes
    └── profile

Now run this command and open the link to show the modification that you made in the config.yaml

hugo serve
title: How did I create this site with Hugo
